alert.note: Alert for Coastal Rockingham (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Statement issued May 17 at 6:32PM EDT until May 18 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 2 AM EDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Minor, nuissance flooding expected in the most vulnerable areas only. * WHERE...In New Hampshire, Coastal Rockingham County. In Maine, Coastal Cumberland and Coastal York Counties. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 2 AM EDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Some water on low lying roads and property. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Hampton Harbor NH MLLW Categories - Minor 11.0 ft, Moderate 12.0 ft, Major 13.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.5 ft, Moderate 2.5 ft, Major 3.5 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 18/01 AM 11.3 1.8 0.8 2 Minor 18/02 PM 9.8 0.3 0.8 1-2 None 19/02 AM 11.2 1.7 0.8 1 Minor 19/03 PM 9.8 0.3 1.0 1-2 None 20/03 AM 11.0 1.5 1.0 1-2 Minor Seavey Island / Portsmouth NH MLLW Categories - Minor 11.5 ft, Moderate 12.5 ft, Major 13.5 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 2.7 ft, Moderate 3.7 ft, Major 4.7 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 18/01 AM 10.9 2.1 0.8 2 None 18/02 PM 9.5 0.7 0.8 1-2 None 19/02 AM 10.9 2.1 0.8 1 None 19/03 PM 9.5 0.7 1.0 1-2 None 20/03 AM 10.9 2.1 1.0 2 None Portland ME MLLW Categories - Minor 12.0 ft, Moderate 13.0 ft, Major 14.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 2.3 ft, Moderate 3.3 ft, Major 4.3 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 18/01 AM 12.1 2.3 0.5 2 Minor 18/02 PM 10.7 1.0 0.8 1-2 None 19/02 AM 12.3 2.6 0.9 2 Minor 19/03 PM 10.9 1.2 1.2 2 None 20/03 AM 12.3 2.6 1.2 2 Minor &&
info.instruction: Do not drive through flooded roadways.
